intro: Chamaemelum fuscatum, commonly known as the black hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a dark center. It is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
